ai.summary: Ardblair Trail is a roughly 9.1 km hike in the United Kingdom of moderate difficulty. The route traverses varied terrain through rural paths and woodland, appealing to hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect varied terrain: forest tracks, grassy paths, and several uneven sections. There may be mild ascents and descents, and footing can be slippery when wet.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather conditions before you go and carry suitable clothing. Wear sturdy footwear and stay on marked paths. Bring a map and compass or GPS, sufficient water and snacks, and a basic first-aid kit. Be mindful of daylight hours in winter and have a plan for emergencies; tell someone your route.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a waterproof shell
Map and compass (or GPS with offline maps)
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (roughly March to October) offer the most favorable conditions, though UK weather can be changeable.

seo.title: Ardblair Trail: 9.1 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Ardblair Trail in the UK. A ~9.1 km moderate hike with varied terrain, practical safety notes, and gear recommendations.
